content: Is the scanner software 32 or 64 bit? If it's 32 bit, TB must be 32 bit for the auto attach to work. TB defaults to 64 bit on 64 bit Windows, although 32 bit TB works fine.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks for your reply , I've been using TB with these scanners for some years and the problem only developed some months ago and all 4 Win 10 systems failed to work, no all 4 say theres no TB associated with the scanner to send email to TB, TB currently is 128.2.3esr (32 Bit), I dont know whether the scanner software is 32 or 64bit, how / where can you find out .............. I cant see anywhere on the MP Navigator EX 2.0 about how many bits it is .......
creator: keith72

content: I would look at where the MP software is installed. If it's in Program Files (x86) it's very likely 32 bit. If it's in Program Files, it's probably 64 bit. TB must also be set as the default mail app in Windows Settings. Do the same in TB Settings/General/System Integration.

content: This is because IMAP always keeps all messages on the server until deleted. The messages on your PC are just copies, but the 'real' message is online. This allows you to have full access to mail from multiple PCs or phone.
creator: davidsk

content: So if I delete a message from one device it is gone, and cannot be downloaded to another device? It surely did not work that way with POP3 and seems like taking a step backwards.
creator: brad.starling

content: That is because POP lets you download to PC and leave on server. It depends on what you want. Many like IMAP because it creates a consistent presentation of your messages so they can be viewed and responded to from any device. And you can see the sent messages from anywhere. There are more people switching from POP to IMAP than the other way around. Still, it's a matter of preference.

content:
Thunderbird cannot access any server to download mail if it's not running.

Please check to see if it's running in the Task Manager. right click on Task bar and select 'Task Manager'

Also check to see if you have another email client running in the background.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Emails can be downloaded if you have only minimised Thunderbird. In which case Thunderbird is not closed it's running.

In Thunderbird

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to 'Incoming Mails' section

This is where you can choose what occurs regarding notifications.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Toad-Hall said
Thunderbird cannot access any server to download mail if it's not running. Please check to see if it's running in the Task Manager. right click on Task bar and select 'Task Manager' Also check to see if you have another email client running in the background.

No - the program is not minimized, it's closed.
creator: jbguit

content:
I've seen an error like this when someone had selected the wrong 'Authentication Method' - they had incorrectly selected 'Encrypted Password' Check your Server Settings. Account Setting > Server Settings: Authentication Method: Normal Password

Also make sure the Outgoing Server SMTP also has same Authentication Method.

After making any changes - please restart Thunderbird. Report back telling us what you found - was the wrong Authentication selected ?

re :despite my changing it which when I try to log-in

There is only one place you can change/modify a password and that is via the webmail account. The normal password you use to logon to webmail account is the same password you use in Thunderbird. If you did update the password in webmail account then update the stored password in Thunderbird It's likely that pasword is stored here:

  • Setting > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • Click on 'Saved PAsswords'
  • Clickon 'Show PAsswords'

If you get a prompt small window - Windows Security' asking for password then it wants this password - when you start up computer and you enter password to access user account to see desktop - it wants that password.

Then locate the relevant lines for the account. One will be incoming either starting with 'mailbox://account...' or 'imap://account....' and there will also be an outgoing line 'smtp://account...'

  • Right click on each line and select 'Edit Password'
  • completely clear contents and then carefully type correct password.
  • click on 'Close' when done

If still stuck post this info: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all the data and paste it into this forum question.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Server settings, Password, transmitted insecurely SMTP, Password,transmitted insecurely
creator: jdfw

content: If you are seeking to get read receipts, I don't know if that is possible with Thunderbird. You can request a receipt that the message has arrived but that is voluntary and unreliable and still does not indicate the message has been opened. There is an addon named mailmindr, available at https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/mailmindr/, but it doesn't seem to address what you want.
creator: davidsk

content:
Emails come from the sender and they may not use xfinity & Comcast servers. xfinity & Comcast are companies that have servers and offer mail accounts. They would not be tampering with the contents of emails they receive on behalf of yourself.

If xfinity themselves did send you an email then the logo maybe contained therein, but in Thunderbird, that logo may not be displayed if it contains remote content. Thunderbird by default does not automatically display any remote content for security reasons.

See info on 'Remote content' https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/remote-content-in-messages
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
When you get an error message it useful to state all the error message word for word OR post an image of it. Often those error messages are sent by the server so any info helps to detect what it is talking about.

re : I was told the problem is on your end.

Who said that ? Did they tell you what the Alert 1014 meant ?

Please logon to your webmail account via a browser and check to see if third party access is enabled - it must be enabled.

  • https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/third-party-email-access


Then post this information: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts'
  • Copy all the data and paste it into this forum question.

Then we can check you have correct server settings.


By any chance - Have you recently logged onto webmail account via a browser and changed your password ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content: There is nothing that Thunderbird can do, since the issue is the IP address. My suggestion is to report this to your email provider, as one of their customers using the same IP is causing the issue to continue repeating. And each time, you get caught in it.

content: This is puzzling, as Thunderbird never bills anyone. The email client is 100% based on donations. This is the tech support forum, and here is the URL that has the right people to investigate this payment in your name. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/donate/help/

content:
The server details have changed. These are the current correct ones:— 

 Server Name: outlook.office365.com  Port: 993  User Name: <your e-mail address>  Connection security:  SSL/TLS  Authentication method: OAuth2

  Outgoing Server (SMTP):— 

 Server Name: smtp.office365.com  Port: 587  Connection security: STARTTLS  Authentication method:  OAuth2  User Name: <your e-mail address>
creator: ThePillenwerfer

content:
I think you need to update your settings to:

incoming IMAP imap.xplore.net, port 993, SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP smtp.xplore.net, port 465, SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

https://support.xplore.ca/s/article/Server-Settings-for-Xplore-Emails?language=en_US
creator: sfhowes
